description.narrative: To contribute to the development and implementation of a new generation of larger scale PWS (Payments for Watershed Services) that engage and benefit rural communities, that value natural infrastructure approaches to better sustain ecosystem health, and act as a cost effective front line defense to climate change. -Major outcomes (objectives) of the project: (1) To improve the watershed management and the livelihoods of the stewards of watershed services in specific regional contexts through the development and the implementation of PWS models. (2) To establish generic standards and analytical tools for the global development and implementation of new large-scale PWS models. (3) To assure the global dissemination of PWS models through setting up a global community of practice that links practitioners with policy makers on different levels. - Key outputs: (1) Established municipal water funds in Santa Cruz Bolivia, (2) An established PWS Incubator (multidisciplinary task-team and think tank) in Peru functional; (3) Feasibility studies for Ghana, Mexico, Brazil and China projects conducted; (4) A tool box of analysis, methodologies, best practices and standards to support new program development and scaling up of PWS efforts around the world. (5) State of watershed payment report no 2 published; (6) A global Community of Practice that is connected by an information portal serving PWS practitioners.
